newsitem.title: USA: Nasdaq ends higher as large-caps rebound.
newsitem.headline: Nasdaq ends higher as large-caps rebound.

text.p: Nasdaq stocks bounced higher on Wednesday in a partial rebound from Tuesday's sharp losses.

The Nasdaq Composite Index rose eight points to about 1228, reversing about half its more than 16 point loss on yesterday, driven higher by a strong performance among large-cap issues. Breadth remained negative, with declining issues beating advancers by a roughly seven to six margin.
"During the selling this morning Nasdaq stocks didn't get below yesterday's lows and then the big-cap names started to go higher," said Scott Bleier, chief investment strategist at Prime Charter Ltd.

Bleier noted the Nasdaq 100 index, which includes the top 100 Nasdaq issues based on market capitalization, gained 13 points to about 750 on the day, well outpacing the performance of the broader composite.
Intel Corp gained 3-7/8 to 109-3/8, Microsoft Corp rose two points to 134-1/2 and Cisco Systems Inc climbed 1-5/8 to 62-7/8.
Spyglass Inc fell 3-1/4 to 13-3/8 after the company said it could lose money for the first half of 1997.
